definitions.definition: The third season of the year; autumn; fall.
definitions.example: Harvest is usually very damp and rainy.

definitions.definition: The season of gathering ripened crops; specifically, the time of reaping and gathering grain.
The process of gathering the ripened crop; harvesting.
The yield of harvesting, i.e., the gathered crops or fruits.
definitions.example: This year's cotton harvest was great but the corn harvest was disastrous.

definitions.definition: (by extension) The product or result of any exertion or course of action; reward or consequences.
A modern pagan ceremony held on or around the autumn equinox, which is in the harvesting season.
To bring in a harvest; reap; glean.
To be occupied bringing in a harvest
definitions.example: Harvesting is a stressing, thirsty occupation
The rising star harvested well-deserved acclaim, even an Oscar under 21
